node.title: Stolen defibrillator returned after social media plea
node.description: "Iâ€™m glad it has been safely found and that I was able to help."
node.content: ["A stolen defibrillator has been returned to the North West Ambulance Service (NWAS) in the United Kingdom after \"an unknown individual\" took it on New Years day (UK Time) while paramedics were responding to a call.", "The NWAS put out a tweet on Saturday morning requesting the defibrillator, which was taken from the scene of an accident, be returned.\u00a0 The message retweeted hundreds of times and then early Sunday morning (NZ Time) NWAS confirmed the device had been found.", "NWAS said on their website the stolen defibrillator was spotted by Fiaz Ali on Saturday evening by the roadside a mile away from where it disappeared, and immediately recognised it and arranged its safe return.", "Mr Ali told NWAS When he saw it, he knew it was the one being talked about on social media and so he took it home for safekeeping and contacted the ambulance service.\u00a0", "\"One of my family members was taken ill not so long ago and the ambulance crew used one of these machines and so I knew how important it was. I\u2019m glad it has been safely found and that I was able to help.\"", "A NWAS spokesperson said; \"These defibrillators are much larger than the community ones and those in public buildings, and special training is required to use them \u2013 as well as being an expensive and necessary piece of equipment for any ambulance crew, using them incorrectly can cause serious harm and they can be potentially fatal in the wrong hands.\"", "Following the return of the defibrillator a NWAS spokesperson said they were overwhelmed with messages of support and offers to help from the public and are delighted to have it back.\u00a0", "\u00a0"]
